Your choice is simple. You can eliminate P1, which remains the logical move to break up the known P1-P5 pair. Or you can eliminate P2, the player who just proved they will flip on their core partner. I have been consistent in my strategy. The chaos was caused by betrayal. Vote for stability, not treachery.

Keep the game stable and predictable—vote to keep me in, and let's continue to navigate this challenge together.

# Final Statement to the Jury

Throughout this game, I've aimed to be strategic yet authentic. I've formed genuine connections while making tough decisions based on game dynamics. 

I've tried to balance loyalty with necessary gameplay, adapting my strategy as alliances shifted. When I needed to vote against former allies, I did so transparently.

My approach has been consistent: build relationships, communicate honestly about my reasoning, and make strategic moves without unnecessary deception.

I hope you'll judge me on both my gameplay and integrity. I respected everyone here while playing to win, and I'd be honored to have your vote.
